intro: Anchietea peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian anchietea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Anchietea peruviana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is appreciated for its delicate appearance.
